settings.text: Debbie Wosskow and Anna Jones launched the AllBright, a female-only members’ club, in 2017. Today they have three clubs, two in London and one in West Hollywood, with more on the way. We photographed the power pair in their favourite pieces from Chinti & Parker’s Resort ’20 collection. Here, they answer 20 questions about everything from being a woman in business to the words they live by.

settings.title: How would you describe the Chinti & Parker woman?
settings.text: She’s me! And also, my friends. She’s like every member of our office, to be honest. The customer is diverse and there is something in the collection for everyone. From the cashmere neutrals in essentials to the more vibrant pieces that express fun and personality.

settings.title: What are your favourite pieces from the AW19 collection?
settings.text: I’ve worn the Charleston floral dress quite a lot and always get compliments and people asking where it is from. The colour-block shirt and the Eccentric pieces are great, and the Luxury jumper feels amazing on. I am also in the process of acquiring every single piece from the Essentials collection , it’s all beautiful.

settings.grid-content:
How would you describe the AllBright in one sentence?
Anna and Debbie: AllBright is a global sisterhood that combines physical clubs, a digital network and content channels to celebrate, connect and inspire women.

What has been your proudest moment since launching the AllBright?
Anna and Debbie: We shed a little tear at the launch party of the AllBright Mayfair…it had been a huge team effort to get it over the line despite being repeatedly told our timeline was ridiculous and it would take at least six months longer to open the doors (but we did it!).

Where would you like to open the next club?
Anna and Debbie: New York is coming next.
What does it mean to you to be a woman in business?
Anna: Mixed emotions…proud of what I’ve achieved so far in my career and frustrated at the on-going existence of inequality across the board for women.

settings.text:
Which women do you admire the most?
Anna: So many women. My co-founder Debbie Wosskow is one of the most remarkable women I have ever met (and lucky me, that we get to run a business together!).

Debbie: I’m lucky that I’m surrounded by amazing women all day at the AllBright clubs. I’m also on the Mayor of London Business Board with superstars like Dame Jayne Anne Gadhia and Nicola Mendelsohn, who are absolutely inspiring.

What would be your one piece of advice to a woman wanting to start their own business?
Anna: Ensure that you’re truly passionate about what you’re about to do. It might be a great idea but if it doesn’t give you energy, don’t do it. You’ll be at it 24/7 in the early days.

Debbie: Make sure you love your idea at the beginning of the journey – it’s a long game and you will spend a lot of time thinking about it and selling the dream.

settings.grid-content:
What keeps you awake at night?
Anna: Not much… manic by day, out cold by night.

Debbie: How to do more and do it better – we have scaled an international business at speed and it’s hard not to sweat the small stuff.

What is the most valuable lesson life has taught you?
Anna: Act with integrity even in life’s most difficult moments.

What or who is the greatest love of your life?
Anna: My husband Marcus and our children Izzy and Alex.
I count my blessings every single day

Favourite mantra / motto?
Anna: Just keep swimming.
Debbie: What’s the worst that can happen?

Last country you visited and why?
Anna: LA in the USA. Specifically, the AllBright West
Hollywood to spend time with our team there, catch up
with members and host a reception for some incredible women.

Debbie: Australia, for a 24 hour flying visit to launch AllBright Connect and the Academy - now that one is brutal.

Last exhibition you went to?
Anna: The Taylor Wessing photographic portrait prize at the National Portrait Gallery
Debbie: Year Three by Steve McQueen at the Tate Britain, my daughter is in it.

Last restaurant you ate at?
Anna: The restaurant at the new Edition Hotel in West Hollywood.
Debbie: Scott’s, Mayfair – and of course the AllBright Mayfair, every day.

What is your most treasured possession?
Anna: I don’t really have one as things are just things, but I do love the eternity ring that my husband bought me. It’s a constant reminder to be grateful for love and family.

What is your favourite book?
Anna: The Secret History by Donna Tartt.
Debbie: I’m on the board of the Women’s Prize for Fiction, so that’s a tricky one, as I’m a big reader. I just finished ‘The Dutch House’ by Ann Patchett, which I loved.

Where would you most like to be right now?
Anna: Right where I am
Debbie: Langkawi, Malaysia

How do you dress for success?
Anna: By wearing classic clothes with some interesting detail that suit my body shape.
Debbie: A dress and a pair of Jimmy Choos.

settings.text:
If you could be remembered for one thing what would it be?
Anna: Building a global sisterhood of incredible women.
Debbie: Building AllBright and changing women’s lives.

What motivates you most?
Anna: Building something from scratch.
Debbie: Trying to be the best I can be.

Where do you see yourself in ten years’ time?
Anna: Looking back and thinking ‘wow, that was an amazing decade!’.
